cyclone.name: DELTA
cyclone.current_location: about 75 miles south of Kingston, Jamaica
cyclone.trajectory: tracking northwest across the north-western Caribbean, forecast to cross western Cuba and then move across the central Gulf of Mexico toward the Louisiana coastline late this week
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: south-central Louisiana coast (near Vermilion Bay to Cameron area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch for Pinar del Rio & Artemisa (Cuba) and Isle of Youth; Tropical Storm Watch La Habana (Cuba)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning for the Cayman Islands
weather_observation.impacted_coast: North-western Caribbean Islands, western Cuba, northern Gulf Coast from Texas–Louisiana border eastward to Mississippi/Alabama coast
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (34-kt) probability at the port is up to 17% within 5 days; hurricane-force winds still very low (<1%) but could increase as the system strengthens in the Gulf.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Early guidance suggests storm surge of 3–5 ft is possible along the southwest Louisiana coast, including Calcasieu Lake and approaches to the port, if DELTA approaches as a hurricane.
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–8 inches of rain possible Friday into Saturday, producing flash-flood potential in the Calcasieu basin and operational disruptions at the port.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes in outer rainbands and significant wave/swell increase in the Calcasieu Ship Channel that can halt pilotage and cargo operations.
